meanings.sent1: The sudden dark clouds were seen as a bodements of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The howling of the wolves was considered a bodements of danger in the old tales.
meanings.sent3: The cat's loud meow in the middle of the night was a bodements of hunger, waking up the whole house.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the forest was a bodements of an impending threat lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor's tales were filled with bodements of ghostly encounters at sea.

meanings.definition: A sign or indication of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The first drops of rain were a bodements of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature was a bodements of the coming winter.
meanings.sent3: The flickering streetlight was a bodements of the power outage about to happen.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums was a bodements of the tribal celebration in the village.
meanings.sent5: The bright morning sun was a bodements of a beautiful day ahead.
